title: Employment reference letters (HR verification)
dataVerified: Employee name, employer name, job title/role, dates employed, (optional) eligibility-for-rehire flag, reference issuer name/title, contact details, reference ID
dataVisibleAfterVerification: Shows the issuer domain and the responder status text (e.g., "OK", "REVOKED", "NOT_FOUND").
rationale:
Prospective employers and background-check providers waste time confirming references via phone/email and are exposed to forged letters. Domain binding verifies the employer’s domain and makes references machine-checkable at point of use. Revocation allows a reference to be withdrawn or corrected (e.g., issued in error). These letters can be short-form and OCR-friendly compared to full HR files.

A reference can also be embedded inside a CV/resume (or appended as separate pages): a “collapsed” interactive CV can expand a specific verified reference on tap, while print defaults to all references expanded.
